p: Various studies in the literature shed light on the potential relationship between an impaired lipid metabolism and different skin conditions, but the extent to which fatty acid transporters are involved in directing fatty acids to keratinocytes, altering the fate of lipid metabolism, remains an open question [ 23]. As far as the current literature goes, normal keratinocytes do not require CD36 for their metabolism; it is only transiently expressed in pathological circumstances such as wounds [ 27], infectious [ 28] and autoimmune [ 29, 30] cutaneous diseases and tumor-related pathologies [ 31]. A stable CD36 expression can be a driver for increased lipid metabolism, which can fuel a possible malignant transformation.
